abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Power Project will help meet
            power demand to the end of 1974. It will consist of
            procurement, installation and commissioning of the fourth
            hydrogenerating unit at Mount Coffee (for which the civil
            works were included in the project financed under the
            earlier loan); and the improvement and expansion of the
            transmission and distribution system in the Monrovia area.
            The total cost of the project is estimated to be $6.4
            million, of which the Bank loan will finance the external
            costs of $4.7 million, or 73 percent of project cost.
